channel.title: CyberNetSec - Policy and Compliance
channel.description: Latest policy and compliance threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: CISA Warns Cisco ASA Devices Still Under Attack, Issues New Patch Guidance
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has issued follow-up implementation guidance for its September Emergency Directive 25-03, which addresses two critical, actively exploited vulnerabilities in Cisco ASA and Firepower devices. The flaws, a remote code execution bug (CVE-...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Policy and Compliance, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: UK Introduces Sweeping Cyber Security and Resilience Bill to Regulate MSPs and Mandate Stricter Breach Reporting
item.description:
The UK government has introduced the Cyber Security and Resilience Bill to Parliament, a landmark piece of legislation set to replace the 2018 NIS Regulations. This new bill significantly expands the regulatory landscape by bringing Managed Service Providers (MSPs) into scope for the first time, a m...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: Pentagon Overhauls Cyber Force Model to Boost USCYBERCOM Readiness
item.description:
The U.S. Department of War (DoW) has announced a new cyber force generation model aimed at enhancing the operational effectiveness, specialization, and lethality of forces assigned to U.S. Cyber Command (USCYBERCOM). The revised plan is designed to create a more integrated and agile cyber force by s...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Security Operations

item.title: EU Governments Under Siege: ENISA Reports Massive Surge in DDoS and Data Attacks
item.description:
A new threat landscape report from the EU Agency for Cybersecurity (ENISA) reveals that public administrations across the European Union are facing a dramatic increase in cyberattacks. DDoS attacks, largely driven by pro-Russia hacktivist groups like NoName057(16), account for 60% of all incidents, ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Policy and Compliance, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: It's Official: DoD Begins Phased Rollout of CMMC Cybersecurity Program
item.description:
The U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) has officially started the phased, three-year implementation of its Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification (CMMC) program as of November 10, 2025. DoD contracting officers can now begin inserting CMMC requirements into new solicitations for the Defense Indust...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Security Operations

item.title: OWASP Top 10 for 2025 Released, Spotlighting Supply Chain and Design Flaws
item.description:
The OWASP Foundation has released the 2025 release candidate for its influential Top 10 list of web application security risks. This update signals a major shift in focus, with the introduction of new categories like 'A03: Software Supply Chain Failures' and 'A10: Mishandling of Exceptional Conditio...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Policy and Compliance, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: OSCE Guide Urges Unified Cyber-Physical Defense for Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
The Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) has published a new technical guide advising governments and operators to adopt a unified approach to securing critical infrastructure. The guide emphasizes the growing convergence of physical and cybersecurity domains, warning that silo...

item.title: Philippines Lawmakers Push for National Cybersecurity Fund
item.description:
In the Philippines, Representatives Migz and Luigi Villafuerte have introduced a proposal to create a 'Cybersecurity Risk Management and Mitigation Fund' (CRMMF). This dedicated national fund would provide the government with the necessary resources to prevent and respond to cyberattacks against bot...

Severity: Informational

item.title: Swedish IT Firm Breach Exposes Data of 1.5 Million, Sparks GDPR Probe
item.description:
The Swedish IT services firm Miljödata has suffered a severe data breach, exposing the personal and potentially sensitive information of over 1.5 million people. The incident, which occurred in late August, resulted in the stolen data being published on the darknet. In response, the Swedish Data Pro...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

item.title: Identity is the New Perimeter: Stolen Credentials and Over-Privileged Accounts Drive Cloud Breaches
item.description:
A consensus is forming across the cybersecurity industry: identity is the new security perimeter in the cloud. New reports from ReliaQuest and Amazon Web Services (AWS) reveal that identity-based attacks are the leading driver of cloud security incidents. Key findings show that compromised credentia...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Cloud Security, Security Operations, Policy and Compliance
